body_html: @poxvoculi, this prototype is not the same as #19391. It also requires the change in how the training and the inference run. It splits the data in one batch evenly on the available NUMA nodes, computes the loss and gradients on each node (no communication between NUMA nodes), and then averages the gradients from each node and apply the update (need to communicate between NUMA nodes).
